description:
At Google, we know building trust with users comes hand-in-hand with the dependable quality and reliability of our products. The Advertising Technology team helps ensure that our advertising products work effectively for our customers. When a Sales team colleague escalates an issue relating to a product such as Google Ads or AdSense, we dig in, using our technical expertise to find the solution. You use your strong computer science background to answer technical questions from colleagues, partners and clients regarding ad specifications and technology. Your communication and sales skills come in handy when you break down complex product features and present them in an easy-to-understand manner. With an array of internal tools at your disposal, you troubleshoot ad functionality and display issues, working on higher-level projects to improve the team's operations. All of your efforts go toward ensuring that our ad products are working and our customers optimize them to deliver desired results.

As a Strategic Partnership Development Manager, you'll work closely with Google Product, Engineering and Marketing teams on new product initiatives and key strategic relationships. This team focuses on programmatic advertising platforms across existing and new channels (e.g. mobile, display, and video), driving non-standard emerging agreements across Google’s ad products such as Google Ads, DV360, Campaign Manager, AdMob and Ad Manager.

Google’s Global Partnerships team works with a wide range of partners to bring the best of Google to power their business. The team partners with Publishers and App Developers of all sizes to promote their ad inventory, working with Google's broad range of partner solutions including AdSense, AdMob and Google Ad Manager, across mobile, display, and video formats, helping our partners and their audiences get the most out of the web. In addition, the Partnerships team supports Google’s own product teams with essential partnerships to help power Google’s user experiences in search, maps, travel, shopping, payments and more.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of relevant agreement experience.
  • Experience working with legal agreements and invoicing.
  • Experience operating within and across cross-functional teams (e.g. Product Management, Implementation, Legal, Finance, Marketing, etc).

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA degree.
  • Experience identifying partners, analyzing and structuring complex agreement structures with a consistent record of execution.
  • Ability to balance multiple high priorities and lead several time-sensitive projects at once in a fast-paced environment with minimal direction.
  • Effective attention to detail, with a passion for and understanding of Google products, and the ability to quickly learn about new technologies.
  • Developed interpersonal and communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Lead exploratory discussions with potential partners for new programs and initiatives.
  • Evaluate opportunities and present recommendations to the management team.
  • Discuss and consult on strategic agreements for the company in the advertising space.
  • Communicate and collaborate with a broad range of constituents (Product, Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Legal and external executives) and help define the Go-to-Market strategy.
  • Develop and execute the business development strategy in advertising.
title: Strategic Partnership Development Manager, Global Ads Partnerships
